title: Quiz 1: Road Signs and Markings
description: Test your knowledge of Kenyan road signs, traffic signals, and road markings

questions.question: What does a red octagonal sign mean?
questions.explanation: A red octagonal (8-sided) sign is universally recognized as a STOP sign. You must come to a complete stop before proceeding.
questions.hint: Think about the shape - how many sides does it have?

media.caption: Kenya STOP sign - Red octagonal shape

questions.question: What does a triangular sign with a red border mean?
questions.explanation: Triangular signs with red borders are warning signs that alert drivers to potential hazards ahead.
questions.hint: These signs warn you about dangers on the road

questions.question: What does a circular sign with a red border and diagonal line mean?
questions.explanation: A red circle with a diagonal line indicates prohibition - something is not allowed.
questions.hint: The diagonal line means 'no' or 'not allowed'

media.caption: Prohibition sign example - Red circle with diagonal line

questions.question: What does a blue circular sign indicate?
questions.explanation: Blue circular signs give mandatory instructions that must be followed.
questions.hint: Blue circles tell you what you MUST do

questions.question: A broken white line on the road means you may cross it to overtake if it is safe to do so.
questions.explanation: A broken white line separates lanes and you may cross it to overtake if it is safe to do so.
questions.hint: Think about what 'broken' means - is it a barrier?

questions.question: What does a continuous yellow line at the edge of the road mean?
questions.explanation: A continuous yellow line at the road edge means no parking is allowed at any time.
questions.hint: Yellow lines are about parking restrictions

questions.question: What should you do when you see a yellow traffic light?

options.text: Stop if safe to do so

questions.explanation: A yellow light means stop if you can do so safely. It warns that the light is about to turn red.
questions.hint: Yellow is a warning - what comes after yellow?

questions.question: Which of the following are types of road signs? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: The main types of road signs are: Warning, Prohibition, Mandatory, and Information signs. There are no 'suggestion' signs.
questions.hint: Think about the four main categories of road signs

questions.question: What does a white 'X' painted on the road mean?
questions.explanation: A white X painted on the road warns of a railway crossing ahead. Be prepared to stop if a train is approaching.
questions.hint: X marks the spot where trains cross the road

questions.question: What does a sign showing two cars side by side mean?
questions.explanation: This sign prohibits overtaking in that section of road. It's usually placed where overtaking would be dangerous.
questions.hint: When two cars are shown together, what are you NOT allowed to do?
